| History                 = Star-Lord and the Guardians were individually captured by different galactic empires to be dealt with separately, as planned by J'son and the Spartax, who wanted his son to join him in his place as the prince of Spartax, but also to make him pay for his crimes against the Spartax Empire.{{r|Guardians of the Galaxy Vol 3 14}} As he was escaping, Quill discredited J'son to the whole empire, revealing him as a heartless murderer. The entire Spartax Empire rebelled against J'son, who was forced to flee.{{r|Guardians of the Galaxy Vol 3 16}}

Once the Black Vortex was dealt with, Star-Lord proposed to Kitty Pryde, and she said yes.{{r|Guardians of the Galaxy & X-Men: Black Vortex Omega Vol 1 1}} Back in Spartax, he had to resolve the problem of his election and after some encouraging words from Kitty, he decided to give in to the desire of the people of Spartax and become the new leader of the Empire.{{r|Guardians of the Galaxy Vol 3 27}}

| Notes                   = * The '''Spartoi Empire''' of the '''Spartoi''' race from the planet '''Spartax''' was first mentioned as the homeworld of '''Prince Jason''' who was heir to the throne of the Empire.{{r|Inhumans Vol 3 2}} This Spartax was located in the Sparta star system of the [[Greater Magellanic Cloud]]{{r|Annihilation: The Nova Corps Files Vol 1 1|; Spartoi's entry}} and this [[Jason (Spartoi) (Earth-616)|Prince Jason]] was intended to be a younger version of the [[Jason (Earth-791)|Emperor Jason]] who ruled his empire from the planet [[Sparta (Planet)|Sparta]] and was the biological father of [[Peter Quill (Earth-791)|Star-Lord]].{{r|Marvel Preview Vol 1 11}}
* A subsequent retcon by [[Brian Michael Bendis]] revealed that the biological father of the [[Peter Quill (Earth-616)|Star-Lord]] who was born on [[Earth-616]] was actually '''King J'Son''',{{r|Guardians of the Galaxy Vol 3 0.1}} ruler of the '''Spartax Empire''' of the '''Spartax''' race from the planet '''Spartax'''.{{r|Guardians of the Galaxy Vol 3 3}}
* The fact that the Spartoi Prince Jason and the Spartax King J'Son could not possibly be the same person means that their respective planets, both named Spartax, could also not be the same.
